sn17.1:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn17.1:1.3: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,
sn17.1:2.1: “Possessions, honor, and popularity are brutal, bitter, and harsh. They’re an obstacle to reaching the supreme sanctuary.
sn17.1:2.2: So you should train like this:
sn17.1:2.3: ‘We will give up arisen possessions, honor, and popularity, and we won’t let them occupy our minds.’
